questions.text: What must be done before deploying to production?

options.text: Deploy directly to production for fastest delivery
options.explanation: Direct production deployment bypasses staging verification.

options.text: Deploy to staging first and execute smoke tests
options.explanation: Per Section 5.4, software must be deployed to staging first with smoke tests before promotion to production.
Quality must approve deployment via the deployment checklist.

options.text: Send an email to the team
options.explanation: Email notification is not a substitute for the formal deployment process.

questions.text: Which integrity verification is included with every release artifact?

options.explanation: The SOP specifies SHA-256, not MD5.
Per Section 5.1, every build output includes a SHA-256 integrity hash of all artifacts.
Photographs are not used for software integrity verification.
Integrity hashes are required per the build process.

questions.text: If a critical issue is found after deployment, the first action is to create a CAPA.
questions.explanation: Per Section 5.5, the first action is to assess severity and scope, then execute a rollback to the previous known-good version. A nonconformance report and CAPA come after containment.

questions.text: What versioning scheme is used for product releases?

options.explanation: The SOP specifies semantic versioning, not date-based.
Simple sequential numbering is not the specified scheme.
Per Section 5.3, version numbers follow semantic versioning (MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH).
The commit SHA is a build identifier, not the version number.

questions.text: Who approves a deployment to production?

options.explanation: Engineering executes deployments but Quality provides approval.
Per Section 5.4, Quality approves deployment after verifying the deployment checklist is complete.

options.text: The developer who wrote the code
options.explanation: The developer cannot self-approve a deployment.

options.text: No approval required for automated deployments
options.explanation: All production deployments require Quality approval regardless of automation.
